page.title: 04LINEAR PARK
page.content: The linear park lies on the site of a single track railway which ran from Manchester to Saddleworth to serve the {'Delph Donkey'}, an historic train of some repute locally. Its present use is both imaginative and useful.Its inception was to recreate the natural countryside and restore land for the use of the community. The park is a success. It is well used by the local community who respect the facility provided for them. The trees are flourishing, the old stone station house,lived in and restored,provides a glimpse into its Victorian past. A children's play area and an old mill cottage nestle alongside the river, blending in perfect harmony with the landscape. Today's environmental planners have utilised the past perfectly to serve the needs of present day society.
